sub_title: HR/OD Consultant | Team Dynamics | Organizational Culture | Staff Well-Being | Values-Based HR
summary:
Shana O'Brien is a freelance consultant providing human resources and organizational development consultancy services to purpose-driven organizations. She has over 13 years of experience in the non-profit sector, primarily with humanitarian organizations. Her areas of focus include team dynamics, organizational culture change, and staff well-being. Most importantly, she is highly values-oriented, and works according to the values of authenticity, courage, empathy, and justice. This includes approaching HR work through a lens of intersectional feminism, anti-racism, decolonization, and diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Shana is passionate about human resources within non-profit organizations as she has experienced first-hand how HR policies/practices can strongly impact the well-being of personnel, the success of organizations, and ultimately the ability of people to achieve their purpose.

She has substantial field experience in countries including Poland, Nepal, India, Georgia, Kenya, Chad, Uganda, Djibouti, South Africa, and Senegal. She has experience working with a variety of donors and international organizations (CARE, Plan, IPPF, European Commission, UNHCR, UNICEF, US BPRM, Red Cross, MSF, RedR, VSO, among others).

authors.headline: HR/OD Consultant | Team Dynamics | Organizational Culture | Staff Well-Being | Values-Based HR

profile_positions.description:
Provide human resources and organizational development (HR/OD) consulting services to non-profit organizations. Previous projects include, for example:

Team dynamics and organizational culture
•	Researched dynamics between national and expatriate staff in Médecins sans Frontières (MSF) and other humanitarian INGOs, including the impact of HR, and provided recommendations to improve HR policies, processes, and practices
•	Conducted a DEI (diversity, equity, and inclusion) audit for an organization
•	Supported an organization to transform a toxic team through conducting an organizational assessment
•	Produced an online training on “Improving Dynamics in Diverse Teams” for DisasterReady (see, with login: https://ready.csod.com/ui/lms-learning-details/app/course/de949688-dbcd-406a-b98c-ecab86712f4a)
•	Transformed HR practices within CHOICE for Youth and Sexuality, including supporting their DEI efforts, developing a salary structure, developing a values-led HR Policy, coaching senior management and Board members, and more

Staff well-being
•	Deepened understanding of staff well-being best practices as a member of the INGO Staff Well-Being Network and the Book Circle for “The Vulnerable Humanitarian”
•	Developed a Staff Well-Being Policy for CHOICE for Youth and Sexuality

Staff development
•	Supported humanitarians (individuals and teams) in their journeys through coaching and mentoring
•	Identified improvements for a staff development program for humanitarian workers in Lebanon, Jordan, Kenya, and Ethiopia for RedR

Other
•	Evaluated the remuneration policy for expatriate personnel for MSF International, which has been used within MSF’s decolonization efforts, by conducting large-scale surveys, interviews, and group discussions (see: https://evaluation.msf.org/evaluation-report/assessment-of-msf-international-remuneration-system-irp2-2017)
•	Created and edited HR documents including staff handbook policies, job descriptions, ToRs, EoIs, etc. for various organizations
profile_positions.title: Human Resources and Organizational Development Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Assisted a humanitarian organization to establish their HR policies, procedures, and practices in the opening phases of a response
•	Set up administrative processes in line with Polish law, transitioning 25 staff onto new contracts
•	Advocated for an inclusive and caring working culture
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Provide HR/OD consultancy services to non-profit organizations. Previous projects include, for example:

Staff well-being
•	Created “Staff Care in Emergencies Guidelines” for use of member organizations of IPPF

Surge mechanisms (HR in emergencies)
•	Assisted CARE International in their first steps towards transformative change for their surge mechanisms, through conducting a review and analysis of the future of surge for humanitarian INGOs
•	Provided recommendations to improve surge efficiency and surge staff well-being and retention, including reviewing best practices and sector trends on surge contracting and rewards, for Plan International and Habitat for Humanity
•	Designed a global humanitarian surge HR mechanism, including pre-deployment guide, ToRs, selection procedures, briefings protocol, etc., for IPPF

Talent management and recruitment and selection
•	Supported Habitat for Humanity’s Africa regional office start-up by providing recommendations for ensuring talent management practices are suited for strategic changes
•	Conducted a labor market analysis for recruitment in Thailand for MSF
•	Analyzed applications to determine short-listing for an emergency roster of a UN agency
•	Mapped humanitarian learning / career development options suited to specific competencies for UN staff

Other
•	Researched and synthesized information on current policies, laws, and initiatives related to safeguarding/ PSEA and sexual harassment in the workplace for WaterAid
profile_positions.title: Associate Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Within the Framework Contracts Unit (short-term projects for the European Commission) for Humanitarian Assistance:
•	Identified and recruited consultants for various projects (screening, shortlisting, interviewing, selecting)
•	Professionalized the organization’s HR practices by formulating and implementing policies, processes, and procedures, including establishing an Employee Handbook, leave policy, performance management system, workplace conduct policies, etc. aligned with Dutch law
•	Updated and maintained the HR database
•	Designed project proposals, including forming teams, creating budgets, and writing methodologies and work plans (independently wrote a project proposal that was granted for 190,000 EUR; part of a team that wrote successful project proposals totalling over 500,000 EUR)
•	Served as Project Manager for "Evaluation of the EU Flood Recovery Programme" in Bosnia and Herzegovina
•	Backstopped ongoing projects (financial management, contractual and logistical arrangements, quality control)

profile_positions.description:
•	Recruited and oversaw the team’s intern and volunteers, including developing onboarding and trainings

•	Managed database of over 6,000 donors

profile_positions.title: Development Associate / Grant Writer

profile_positions.description:

•	Evaluated and monitored project progress to implement procedural changes
•	Recruited, trained, and led a team of over 20 volunteers and interns, including conducting performance appraisals and creating job development plans for highly skilled volunteers

•	Ensured effective communication between all parties involved in a disaster by serving as a communications hub
profile_positions.title: Community Resource Project Manager; Operations Support Specialist

•	Using industry research, took independent initiative to propose changes to upper management in order to increase program efficiency and decrease staff burnout

profile_positions.title: Disaster Response Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
•Assist in asylum-seekers centers as needed: food distribution, setting up logistics, etc.
•Completed donation intake and processing for recent refugee arrivals in the Netherlands

•	Led a group of volunteers to provide vital supplies, funds, and volunteer support in Calais, France
•	Was responsible for recruitment, logistics, and crowdsourced fundraising

"Metis - Women Growing Together” has three main aims: 1) to empower women by increasing connections between women with a migration background and the wider Dutch society; 2) to decrease the vulnerability of refugee women, thereby improving their psychological and physical health; and 3) to contribute to a more peaceful society through increasing social cohesion, trust among members of the Dutch society and its newcomers, and societal participation and employability of network members. As a co-founder of this organization, I was responsible for a variety of tasks including proposal writing, budgetting, event coordination, recruitment, internal communications, developing partnerships with other local organizations, and other tasks as needed.

•	Mentored recently-arrived asylum seekers in Groningen to assist in their adjustment to Dutch society
•	Built relationships between asylum seekers and local community members

•Surveyed expats in the Northern Netherlands regarding their needs
•Assisted in event organizing for a professional development fair for expats, including developing and implementing a marketing strategy

company.name: Plateforme Citoyenne de Soutien aux Refugies (Citizen's Platform to Support Refugees)

volunteer_experiences.description:
•Contributed to a grassroots organization to help refugees in Brussels

•Trained to respond to local emergencies
•Managed the organization's Facebook and Twitter accounts

Client Casework Service Associate (San Juan, PR)

Disaster Action Team Member (Washington, DC; San Juan, PR; Chicago, IL)

Restoring Family Links Caseworker, International Services (Chicago, IL)

Bulk Distribution Service Associate (Chicago, IL)
•	Created mobile bulk distribution routes by designing a live Google Earth map that synced information from disaster assessment teams, calls from the community, mass care teams, and other sources during widespread Illinois flooding
•	Assisted in compiling financial and statistical information from a large logistical operation

Local Community Volunteer (San Juan, PR)
•	Led a team of volunteers to design and implement the Puerto Rico chapter’s Volunteer Connection website

•	Mentored a Somali woman and her family who were recently resettled to Chicago after being displaced to a Ugandan refugee camp
•	Created lessons in English, American culture, and everyday skills in order to ease refugees’ adjustments to the U.S.

company.name: Illinois Coalition for Immigrant and Refugee Rights (ICIRR)
